intro: Melampyrum nemorosum var. debreceniense, commonly known as the Hungarian touch-me-not, is a herbaceous plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-orange flowers arranged in clusters, which are typical of the genus Melampyrum. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a distinctive yet relatively uncommon species within its native range.
